transcript:
0:00:30	None
 So....

0:00:37	SPEAKER_02
 Bock's coming.

0:00:41	SPEAKER_02
 2019 o'clock, Okay now.

0:00:56	None
 Okay.

0:01:03	SPEAKER_01
 Hey everybody, welcome to the detailed design meeting.

0:01:13	SPEAKER_01
 Let's see, our agenda.

0:01:19	SPEAKER_01
 Last time we discussed the squishy fruitiness of our remote controls and how we might pursue that.

0:01:28	SPEAKER_01
 And I think it looks like we've come up with some ideas.

0:01:32	SPEAKER_01
 And we also talked about materials we'd use and what kind of chip would be necessary.

0:01:39	SPEAKER_01
 So, for later in the meeting I've done a spreadsheet of production costs.

0:01:45	SPEAKER_01
 So we'll take a look at that and see if it's changed at all from when we last discussed it.

0:01:55	SPEAKER_01
 So, actually, yeah.

0:02:04	SPEAKER_01
 You guys want to give a prototype presentation?

0:02:09	SPEAKER_02
 Okay, well, so our design looks something like this.

0:02:15	SPEAKER_02
 This being the wheel that you use to change channels or volume or whatever.

0:02:20	SPEAKER_02
 So, the button serves as the power button if you hold it down and you just tap on it.

0:02:25	SPEAKER_02
 I think it brings up the menu.

0:02:28	SPEAKER_02
 And the base of the remote control, which has a squishy sponge you'd ever feel, is interchangeable.

0:02:35	SPEAKER_02
 So, you can change the color according to, you know, the suit your living room or whatever.

0:02:39	SPEAKER_02
 I can change the vegetable.

0:02:41	SPEAKER_02
 Yeah, I can change the vegetable.

0:02:42	SPEAKER_01
 It was that broccoli.

0:02:43	SPEAKER_02
 Yeah, broccoli.

0:02:45	SPEAKER_02
 So, this snaps off and you can put on whichever one you want.

0:02:51	SPEAKER_02
 This is not to scale because it would have the battery inside it.

0:02:54	SPEAKER_02
 It's a mango.

0:02:55	SPEAKER_02
 It's trendy fruit.

0:02:56	SPEAKER_02
 It's not just ordinary fruits.

0:02:57	SPEAKER_02
 You don't have orange.

0:02:58	SPEAKER_02
 You have mango.

0:02:59	SPEAKER_02
 I guess strawberries, not just trans-eat.

0:03:02	SPEAKER_02
 Very bright strawberry.

0:03:03	SPEAKER_02
 So, we'll come up with a variety of trendy and exciting fruit designs for the remote control.

0:03:10	SPEAKER_02
 And the people will be encouraged to buy three or five of them because they'll need to switch them up.

0:03:14	SPEAKER_02
 It's been a little bit difficult to make sure that it's hand-holdable and that the user can use it.

0:03:22	SPEAKER_02
 You know, it's not too big.

0:03:24	SPEAKER_02
 But we think that this size will be okay.

0:03:29	SPEAKER_02
 And we will have to fit the battery case in there somehow.

0:03:33	SPEAKER_02
 And I guess the only other thing that we really didn't talk about was design yet, actually, would be the thing, the locator.

0:03:44	SPEAKER_02
 So, the locator is just chip it inside there.

0:03:46	SPEAKER_02
 Okay. So, that's just...

0:03:47	SPEAKER_02
 The beeper is also inside there too, somewhere.

0:03:49	SPEAKER_02
 So, you have to have a button on your...

0:03:51	SPEAKER_02
 You have to attach the button to the...

0:03:53	SPEAKER_02
 Yeah, we didn't design that.

0:03:54	SPEAKER_00
 Yeah, we have that...

0:03:55	SPEAKER_02
 But it would be coordinating with that.

0:03:58	SPEAKER_02
 Yeah.

0:03:59	SPEAKER_02
 Hit that...

0:04:00	SPEAKER_02
 You know, match the handset.

0:04:02	SPEAKER_02
 Get up the broccoli.

0:04:04	SPEAKER_02
 Mango.

0:04:06	SPEAKER_02
 Ta-da.

0:04:08	SPEAKER_01
 If you want to look in your project documents folder, there's a Excel spreadsheet.

0:04:20	SPEAKER_01
 The only one that's in there, production costs.

0:04:25	SPEAKER_01
 And if you open it up, I've just stuck the numbers in.

0:04:29	SPEAKER_01
 There's a real challenge there.

0:04:31	SPEAKER_01
 But if I missed anything that we've gone over, or if you see something in that, it has changed.

0:04:39	SPEAKER_01
 I mean, we decided on batteries.

0:04:41	SPEAKER_01
 And the regular chip would be necessary for the more advanced iPod-like button.

0:04:52	SPEAKER_01
 I said, Uncurved or flat.

0:04:55	SPEAKER_01
 I think that's what you have there.

0:04:57	SPEAKER_01
 For the plastic part would be...

0:04:59	SPEAKER_02
 My impression was that flat meant like one of the square remotes.

0:05:03	SPEAKER_02
 But it's really not very clear.

0:05:05	SPEAKER_02
 Because you've got single curve and double curve.

0:05:08	SPEAKER_02
 I don't know what that means.

0:05:10	SPEAKER_02
 One side is curved and then the other side is curved.

0:05:14	SPEAKER_01
 Well, if we're talking about the area just...

0:05:20	SPEAKER_01
 I don't know.

0:05:21	SPEAKER_01
 I guess we'd have to contact the company that makes them and see.

0:05:28	SPEAKER_01
 So what else?

0:05:29	SPEAKER_01
 There's plastic for that area around the button.

0:05:33	SPEAKER_01
 And then rubber would be the squishy, like saying, right?

0:05:38	SPEAKER_01
 And lots of special colors, actually.

0:05:43	SPEAKER_01
 School wheel.

0:05:44	SPEAKER_01
 Do you see anything that I've missed?

0:05:46	SPEAKER_02
 No, I think that's all right.

0:05:48	SPEAKER_01
 Okay.

0:05:49	SPEAKER_01
 So that would make our total of 11.9, which is...

0:05:54	SPEAKER_01
 And less than 12.5, which means we'd be making more of a profit.

0:05:59	SPEAKER_01
 And if we saw a lot of squishy things...

0:06:02	SPEAKER_01
 Ooh, yeah.

0:06:05	SPEAKER_01
 Okay.

0:06:08	None
 So...

0:06:11	SPEAKER_00
 Hmm.

0:06:20	SPEAKER_01
 What did you work on?

0:06:30	SPEAKER_02
 I've got some evaluation criteria.

0:06:33	SPEAKER_02
 Okay.

0:06:34	SPEAKER_02
 I've got the presentation.

0:06:36	SPEAKER_02
 Silence.

0:06:37	SPEAKER_02
 Okay.

0:06:40	SPEAKER_02
 All right.

0:06:49	SPEAKER_02
 What happens is we have to decide whether this whole project we've been working on, and actually meet the standards we were set at the start.

0:07:06	SPEAKER_02
 Okay.

0:07:07	SPEAKER_02
 The method is...

0:07:14	SPEAKER_02
 Well, I've analyzed the user requirements and integrated them to the TransFunding Marketing reports and in our company's strategy marketing.

0:07:25	SPEAKER_02
 And the findings were that we needed to look in a certain way, feel in a certain way.

0:07:32	SPEAKER_02
 And this is everything's listed down.

0:07:35	SPEAKER_02
 Looking in a certain way, feel in a certain way.

0:07:38	SPEAKER_02
 It has to be technologically and overtive.

0:07:41	SPEAKER_02
 And it has to be easy to use.

0:07:43	SPEAKER_02
 These are all things we looked at at the start.

0:07:46	SPEAKER_02
 And criteria that have to be met.

0:07:48	SPEAKER_02
 We have to use a table.

0:07:50	SPEAKER_02
 I'll show you that later together to decide whether it meets the standards.

0:07:54	SPEAKER_02
 And we have therefore in total, we have five...

0:08:03	SPEAKER_02
 We have 11 points according to which this should be evaluated.

0:08:09	SPEAKER_02
 And the quite...

0:08:11	SPEAKER_02
 Well, basically the findings are the same as the evaluation criteria.

0:08:15	SPEAKER_02
 I would like to show you the table we have to use.

0:08:19	SPEAKER_02
 No? This is the table.

0:08:25	SPEAKER_02
 Can you see this here?

0:08:28	SPEAKER_02
 So the questions I've given you...

0:08:31	SPEAKER_02
 Could you write that down?

0:08:32	SPEAKER_02
 True is one and four is seven.

0:08:38	SPEAKER_02
 And we'll just go through each point together.

0:08:46	SPEAKER_02
 I think if each of us gives an opinion, then they can be mixed somehow.

0:08:50	SPEAKER_02
 I don't know how it works, exactly.

0:08:52	None
 Yeah.

0:08:52	SPEAKER_00
 I've been told...

 Is it possible that we can bring this up on our own?

0:08:57	SPEAKER_02
 Yeah, it's in the...

0:08:59	SPEAKER_02
 It's in the project documents.

0:09:01	SPEAKER_02
 Is it meeting three minutes now?

0:09:03	SPEAKER_02
 It's called evaluation criteria.

0:09:07	SPEAKER_02
 And it's...

0:09:10	SPEAKER_02
 Under evaluation.

0:09:12	SPEAKER_01
 The PowerPoint one.

0:09:14	SPEAKER_01
 Yeah, okay, cool.

 We found that open.

0:09:24	SPEAKER_02
 So it was...

0:09:27	SPEAKER_02
 Yeah, choose one.

0:09:34	SPEAKER_02
 Choose one and four is seven.

 Do you want us to discuss this together?

0:09:37	SPEAKER_02
 Do you want us to do it, sing?

 We can do it separately and then discuss it.

0:09:42	SPEAKER_01
 If that's what people want to do.

 So it's actually a scale.

 Wait, one is true and...

 So these are the questions we're answering.

 Yes.

 And one is...

 If it's fancy, you put one.

 One, right.

0:10:02	SPEAKER_02
 If it's really unfancy, it's...

 If it's somewhere in between, you put four.

 Yeah, something.

0:10:07	SPEAKER_01
 Yeah.

 Does it feel fancy?

 It feels like a video.

 No.

 There should already be questions.

 I'm going to say yes.

0:11:57	SPEAKER_02
 Yes.

 Very, very true.

0:12:38	None
 I'm going to say yes.

 2.

summary.summary_text: Bock is coming to the detailed design meeting at 2019 o'clock. Speaker and his colleagues are discussing the design of the remote control. They are also discussing the materials they would use and what kind of chip would be necessary. They will also discuss the production costs. Speakers will give a prototype presentation.
